p: The ‘S’ protein of coronavirus can bind to host cells through the ACE2 receptor found in the oral and nasal mucosa [ 1, 4]. Other sites where ACE2 receptors are found are lungs, stomach, intestine, bladder, heart, and kidney [ 5]. Variable presentation of disease in different age groups, serious manifestations that are seen more commonly in immune-compromised, old aged and in those with underlying pathology, many asymptomatic cases in pediatric age group, and presence of lymphopenia in the majority of the cases; these factors implies that immunity has a vital role in the pathogenesis of COVID-19 [ 1, [6], [7], [8]]. It is assumed that our immune system has lack of memory against such a virus that gave it an edge over humans [ 3].
